clues.text: At a 2005 auction, paintings by Warhol & Renoir didn't sell, but 3 by Congo, one of these playful primates, did
The "Citrus Obsession" version of this classic Mattel doll is scented to smell like a piece of fruit
Hey, Bullwinkle!  On Aug. 16, 2001, one of these large deer took a dip in a swimming pool near Spokane
It sounds rude, but this 5-letter word is the correct term for a ventriloquist's puppet
I was disappointed that Miss Pluto & Miss Venus weren't contestants in this international pageant run by Donald Trump
Highest average salary
Uses a center
Has no teams based outside the continental U.S.
Plays its championship at a theoretically neutral site
Has cancelled an entire season due to labor woes
Teens go ape over the opera in which this gigantic movie ape falls for Vermeer's "Girl with a Pearl Earring"
In a Menotti opera Madame Flora is a fake one of these psychics; Patricia Arquette plays a title one on TV
You could say there's a lot at stake in "Giovanna d'Arco", Verdi's opera about this saint
The ghosts of Louis XVI & his court return to one of their favorite haunts in "The Ghosts of" this French palace
A high school graduation party leads to romance in "The Tender Land" by this "Appalachian Spring" composer
Her "Little Women" appeared in 1868; a mere 127 years later, her "A Long Fatal Love Chase" arrived
In addition to "Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea", he wrote an 1887 story on the Civil War, "North Against South"
"All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others" in a 1945 book by this author
In 1840 he hit a Bumppo in the road & penned "The Pathfinder"
In 1863 this Russian wrote "The Cossacks", a short novel based on his travels with the army
While they pack calcium, vitamin E & fiber, packs of these have been banned in some schools & on some airplanes
Like shark, swordfish contain high levels of this toxic element, so limit yourself
McDonald's says one of its priorities is to reduce & eliminate these, the "TF" in TFAs, from its fried foods
Tea, grape juice & blueberries are all rich in substances called anti- these that help prevent cell damage
Be sure to eat your leafy green vegetables; they're full of this "special" vitamin that makes the blood clot
This highest natural singing voice for women is Italian for "what is above"
This wood-eating insect gets its name from the Latin for "wood-eating worm"
This ground-meat sandwich gets its name from a German port city
This word for a kind of land mass comes from a word meaning "to contain"
This term for a leading character of a literary work comes from the Greek for "first combatant"
Barry Bonds, among others, is currently trying to break this man's home run record of 755
This 7-time Tour de France champ said the 2006 NYC Marathon was the "hardest physical thing" he'd ever done
From 1984 to 1992, 2 of the 3 players who won all the NBA MVP awards
clues.response: Magic Johnson & Larry Bird (& Michael Jordan)

clues.text: In 1904 he became the first pitcher in the American League to throw a perfect game; now an award is named for him
This Czech-born woman who retired in 2006 won a record 9 Wimbledon Singles Championships
Cadets attend a dance at a girls' school in "Graduation Ball", a ballet set in this capital of Austria
The 2000 ballet "Todo Buenos Aires" features different interpretations of this sensual ballroom dance
I may say "neigh!" if you do a pas de cheval, a ballet step that imitates this animal
He designed sets & costumes for "Where the Wlid Things Are", a ballet based on his own beloved book
The Carolina Ballet debuted a 2006 work based on this stormy Shakespearean shipwreck saga
A Black Molly or 2 would be perfect to keep this calming crib feature in your living room free from algae
Sit down in this chair with an X-shaped frame & a canvas seat, perfect for yelling, "Quiet on the set!"
Chandeliers look great but nowadays don't usually use these items from which their name is derived
In the furniture sense, this synonym of "pride" is dressing table
Wanna put your feet up? How about on one of these with a "Turkish" name
Chat about this in your chat room: "chat" is merely a shortened form of this 7-letter word
This name for a work of art that you may carve in art class comes from the Latin for "to carve"
If you say, "I'm eating a hot dog with" this, you could mean a chopped pickle topping or just plain enjoyment
Someone who sees a crime is an eyewitness; someone who experiences it aurally is this similar word
The name of these small towers often seen on castles comes from Old French for "small towers"
William Booth founded this charitable "army" on July 5, 1865 in London
On July 20, 1861 the Congress of the Confederate States began holding sessions in this Virginia city
A July 17, 1917 royal proclamation changed the name of the British royal family to this, like a castle
John Adams' dying words on this date in 1826 were that Thomas Jefferson still lived; John Adams was wrong
In July 1893 this president underwent a secret operation to remove part of his jaw due to cancer
This "American Idol" judge told one contestant, "You sounded like Cher after she's been to the dentist"
This ABC series set at Mode magazine is based on the hit Columbian telenovela "Yo Soy Betty, La Fea"
This Neil Patrick Harris sitcom is narrated through flashbacks from the future
Penn Jillette hosts this NBC game show about first impressions
In its 1st episode, citizens of a Kansas town saw a mushroom cloud on the horizon & were cut off from the outside world

rounds.text: The last entry in the Random House Webster's unabridged dictionary is used to represent this annoying sound
